perturbation.original_text:
9.1   eBix shall own and retain all right, title and interest in and to any
      About Customer data generated on the Insurance Center, and nothing in this
      Agreement shall confer in About any right, title or interest in
      the About Customer data (except to the extent that it is duplicative of
      About User data and as hereinafter provided). Upon request by About, ebix
      shall provide About with About Customer Data in the aggregated form, which
      aggregated form shall be jointly owned by ebix and About. During the Term
      and any time thereafter, eBix shall not sell, lease, transfer,
      disseminate, display or otherwise disclose any About User data to any
      third party or otherwise use the same for any reason other than as set
      forth herein. However, ebix shall not be prohibited from selling, leasing,
      transferring, disseminating, displaying or otherwise disclosing any About
      Customer Data, as defined in Section 1 above.
9.2   About shall own and retain all right, title and interest in and to any
      About User data generated within the About Network (other than the
      Insurance Center), and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in eBix any
      right, title or interest in or to the About User Data (other than the
      Insurance Center and except to the extent that it is duplicative of About
      Customer Data).
perturbation.changed_text:
9.1   eBix shall own and retain all right, title and interest in and to any
      About Customer data generated on the Insurance Center, and nothing in this
      Agreement shall confer in About any right, title or interest in
      the About Customer data (except to the extent that it is duplicative of
      About User data and as hereinafter provided). Upon request by About, ebix
      may, at its sole discretion, provide About with About Customer Data in the aggregated form, which
      aggregated form shall be solely owned by ebix. During the Term
      and any time thereafter, eBix shall have the right to sell, lease, transfer,
      disseminate, display or otherwise disclose any About User data to any
      third party or otherwise use the same for any reason. However, ebix shall not be required to obtain consent
      for selling, leasing,
      transferring, disseminating, displaying or otherwise disclosing any About
      Customer Data, as defined in Section 1 above.
9.2   About shall own and retain all right, title and interest in and to any
      About User data generated within the About Network (other than the
      Insurance Center), and nothing in this Agreement shall confer in eBix any
      right, title or interest in or to the About User Data (other than the
      Insurance Center and except to the extent that it is duplicative of About
      Customer Data).
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that About Customer Data is jointly owned when aggregated and eBix is prohibited from selling About User Data. The modified text contradicts this by stating aggregated About Customer Data is solely owned by Ebix and Ebix has the right to sell About User Data, creating uncertainty about data ownership and usage rights. Added that ebix shall have the right to sell About User data, meaning ebix can sell data without the consent from About. This creates an enforcement issue as the contract now has conflicting terms. All of the original sentences were preserved.

perturbation.original_text:
13.6 Upon termination of this Agreement, any and all licenses granted by one
party to the other hereunder shall immediately terminate, and the parties shall
immediately cease the use of the other party's Marks, material or content
provided in connection with this Agreement, and shall remove all Links to and
from one another's Sites, and About shall remove all Links between the About
Network and the Insurance Center. Each party shall return the Confidential
Information of the other party.
perturbation.changed_text:
13.6 Upon termination of this Agreement, licenses granted by one party to the other hereunder may continue at the discretion of the granting party.  The parties should cease the use of the other party's Marks, material or content
provided in connection with this Agreement, pending further negotiation. Removal of Links to and
from one another's Sites, and the Links between the About
Network and the Insurance Center is optional.  Each party will reasonably consider returning the Confidential
Information of the other party.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces uncertainty regarding the actions required upon termination. The original text mandates immediate termination of licenses, cessation of use of materials, and removal of links. The modified text makes all of these actions discretionary or subject to further negotiation, directly contradicting the original clear directives.  This could lead to disputes over continued use of licensed materials and links after termination. The words such as "may continue", "pending further negotiation", "is optional", "will reasonably consider" all create issues. All of the original sentences were preserved.

perturbation.original_text:
15.4  This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the state where a suit is
properly filed under the terms of this paragraph, being either Illinois or New
York, and without giving effect to conflict of law principles. Litigation
initiated by ebix shall be filed in New York, whereas litigation initiated by
About shall be filed in Illinois. Both parties submit to personal jurisdiction
of Illinois or New York, to effectuate the terms of this paragraph, and further
agree that any cause of action arising under this Agreement shall be brought in
state or federal courts of the States of New York or Illinois, counties of New
York or Cook, respectively.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.4 This Agreement will be governed by the laws of Delaware, regardless of where a suit is filed, and without regard to conflict of law principles. Litigation may be initiated in any jurisdiction deemed suitable by the initiating party. Both parties consent to jurisdiction in Delaware for any disputes arising from this agreement; however, this does not preclude either party from pursuing legal action elsewhere. Any cause of action related to this Agreement can be brought in any state or federal court, at the plaintiff's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies Illinois or New York as the governing law and dictates the venue for litigation based on which party initiates the suit. The modified text introduces several contradictions: it establishes Delaware law as the governing law, allows litigation to be initiated in any jurisdiction, and while consenting to jurisdiction in Delaware, it does not prevent actions elsewhere. This creates significant uncertainty regarding which laws and courts will govern disputes, potentially leading to forum shopping and increased litigation costs. All of the original sentences were preserved.
